subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yep April you are right. Remaining open to the possibility is hard enough f=
or most people. Again its a case of prove or disprove it for yourself. Not =
everyone comes to the same conclusions or gets the exact same results. Mayb=
e similar but not exact. 
=A0
I tend to use a variety of methods. When voic=
es come from things such as water or out of thin air sometimes its a easier=
 for some to believe there is something there that they were not aware of.
=

But again they have to prove it for themselves to be able to have that eye=
 opening moment.
=A0
I only comment on what I hear or dont hear. My speaker=
 set up is a bit different than most. I hate headphones. Others prefer them=
. Some use pc speakers. Results vary based on the individual. What I hear y=
ou may not then again you just might hear it exactly the same. I dont worry=
 about that. Just keep exploring with an open mind.
=A0
Misty
=A0
=A0
=A0

=
--- On Thu, 8/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@...>=
 wrote:


From: April Abercrombie <april@...>
Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Da=
te: Thursday, August 20, 2009, 10:01 AM


=A0 




To be honest, I am still=
 very skeptical about the Frank's Box type of technology, as I have not hea=
rd=A0anything convincing enough for me=A0personally to say yeah-that is spi=
rit communication. But I do remain open to the possibility.
=A0
But that is=
 my problem not anyone else's,=A0and this is why I have refrained from comm=
enting too much on anyone's results.
=A0

----- Original Message ----- 
Fro=
m: bulletbabea 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 2=
009 8:32 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...

=A0 

I think it =
varies depending on who you ask as well as what they have personally experi=
enced. As an example, some people believe in angels and demons others do no=
t. Therefor some may get messages that correspond to their own beliefs as w=
ell as the beliefs of those who are speaking.

Almost every person who does=
 this eventually develops a theory that may change over time based on what =
they experience and what their beliefs are. Then there are those who remain=
 undecided or have doubts.

As for me I look at it as purely educational, a=
 learning experience. Ive met many people I never knew existed. Ive researc=
hed topics I'd never even considered. Ive gotten messages and images that a=
re awe inspiring and many interesting concepts to ponder and explore.

Ther=
e are many glimpses of truth, as well as momentary proof along the way that=
 lead me to develop my own theory and eventually you will develop your own =
too. This research is fascinating and can be quite mind blowing.

I dont wo=
rry what anyone else thinks. I have no need to prove anything to anyone els=
e. They can do that for themselves. I always say honesty is the best policy=
 and if you are honest with yourself and others the only ones who object ar=
e those who's lies arent tolerated. So just look for the truth yourself and=
 dont let me or anyone else tell you what that is. 

It's a great journey a=
nd your path is your own!

Misty

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "mrscapt=
ainjack2" <jjkamp@...> wrote:
>
> Thank you, guys, but I just wanted to mak=
e sure -- really sure. Sometimes it's hard on here to figure out which post=
 is replying to which!
> 
> So I've been thinking about this over and over =
-- I've been able to think of little else in the last few days -- trying to=
 figure this out and make some sort of reasonable theory I can live with. I=
 know we will never have a true answer, at least not any time soon, but sur=
ely those who have been doing this for years and years must have a working =
theory on what these entities are? Based on their behavior rather than what=
 they say? Based on consistencies from researcher to researcher? Based on t=
hings these entities know and don't know (e.g. knew my dad's friend Gordy w=
as dead, while I did not)?
>
